text: Nico (born Christa Päffgen; 16 October 1938 – 18 July 1988) was a German singer, songwriter, actress, and Warhol Superstar. She is featured on the first album by the New York rock band The Velvet Underground, The Velvet Underground & Nico. She was born in Cologne. She grew up in Brandenburg and Berlin. She made seven studio albums. She died on holiday in the Spanish island of Ibiza, of a cerebral hemorrhage while riding her bicycle. Nico was born Christa Päffgen. When she was 16 the photographer Herbert Tobias gave her the name Nico. Nico moved to Paris and began working for Vogue, Tempo, Vie Nuove, Mascotte Spettacolo, Camera, Elle, and other fashion magazines. ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== Year Album details 1967 The Velvet Underground & Nico * Release date: March 12, 1967 * Label: Verve Records Chelsea Girl * Release date: October 9, 1967 * Label: Verve Records 1968 The Marble Index * Release date: November 1, 1968 * Label: Elektra Records 1970 Desertshore * Release date: December 20, 1970 * Label: Reprise Records 1974 The End... * Release date: November 11, 1974 * Label: Island Records 1981 Drama of Exile * Release date: July 3, 1981 * Label: Aura 1985 Camera Obscura * Release date: July 12, 1985 * Label: Beggars Banquet Records ==References== Category:1938 births Category:1988 deaths Category:Contraltos Category:Deaths from cerebral hemorrhage Category:Entertainers from Berlin Category:German singers Category:People from Brandenburg Category:Actors from Cologne Category:Rock singers Category:Elektra Records artists
title: Nico
